36#include "krb5_locl.h"
37
38/*
39 * Convert the simple string `s' into a NULL-terminated and freshly allocated
40 * list in `list'. Return an error code.
41 */
42
43static krb5_error_code
44string_to_list (krb5_context context, const char *s, krb5_realm **list)
45{
46
47 *list = malloc (2 * sizeof(**list));
48 if (*list == NULL)
49 return krb5_enomem(context);
50 (*list)[0] = strdup (s);
51 if ((*list)[0] == NULL) {
52 free (*list);
53 return krb5_enomem(context);
54 }
55 (*list)[1] = NULL;
56 return 0;
57}
58
59/*
60 * Set the knowledge of the default realm(s) in `context'.
61 * If realm != NULL, that's the new default realm.
62 * Otherwise, the realm(s) are figured out from configuration or DNS.
63 */
64
65KRB5_LIB_FUNCTION krb5_error_code KRB5_LIB_CALL
66krb5_set_default_realm(krb5_context context,
67 const char *realm)
68{
69 krb5_error_code ret = 0;
70 krb5_realm *realms = NULL;
71
72 if (realm == NULL) {
73 realms = krb5_config_get_strings (context, NULL,
74 "libdefaults",
75 "default_realm",
76 NULL);
77 if (realms == NULL)
78 ret = krb5_get_host_realm(context, NULL, &realms);
79 } else {
80 ret = string_to_list (context, realm, &realms);
81 }
82 if (ret)
83 return ret;
84 krb5_free_host_realm (context, context->default_realms);
85 context->default_realms = realms;
86 return 0;
87}
